required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of Filler Agent Composed of Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells and Hyaluronic Acid

lead_sponsor.agency: South China Research Center for Stem Cell and Regenerative Medicine

clinical_study.source: South China Research Center for Stem Cell and Regenerative Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of this study is to evaluate the safety and exploratory efficacy of the injectable filler agent composed of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells and hyaluronic acid for the improvement of wrinkles, acne, pitting scar and so on.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with non-serious and serious adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline up to week 12 after injection.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at week 2, 6 and 12.
secondary_outcome.description: An improvement was judged by the outcome of the preoperative grade minus the postoperative grade in accordance with the Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS).The severity was measured using the Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS), where 0 = Absent, 1 = Mild, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Severe, and 4 = Extreme, which is an ordinal scale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at week 2, 6 and 12.
secondary_outcome.description: An improvement was judged by the outcome of the preoperative grade minus the postoperative grade in accordance with the Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS).

arm_group.description: Multipoint of Transdermal injection into the wrinkles. Injectable filler agent composed of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells (UCMSCs) and hyaluronic acid (HA).
Procedure: Transdermal injection of hyaluronic acid only.

intervention.intervention_name: umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells and hyaluronic acid
